qZhnqoAlDuT9hP67Eq0ayg.text: this place is very hyped up, although its just standard food and high prices, I would prefer to go somewhere else, although it is worth going once just to say you have been there, great decorations inside with movie memorabilia, and good atmosphere and must admit the food did taste good.

EnUQtW7eSPQLXcmOvf5VVg.text: What can I say about PLANET HOLLYWOOD? Well for a start we didnt manage to get there for the table of 13 we booked on the 26/03/11...yes thats right, the night of the bad riots going on in London right by the Planet Hollywood. When we phoned them up 40 mins before our due arrival to explain that NO TAXI would take us and our 5 YOUNG CHILDREN down that way due to the riots, we were treated as if we were being silly and asked if we could walk there instead... YES,WITH OUR CHILDREN, we told them we were not putting our children's lives at risk and could we have a refund for the deposit of £130 or a credit note lasting about 18months as we are from Wales and only go up to London once a year....We were told that they do not give refunds and that the credit note will only last 3 months. We were also told that we were the only people who didnt turn up and our table of 13 was there empty...if it was that busy, why was the table empty all night isn't it? The riots were still going on into Sunday morning so somehow I dont think we were the only family that couldn't get there. Terrible service and we are not likely to let this matter go I can assure you!!!! I would be interested to know if anyone else has had the same problem due to the riots

K91N81TOOU8Ja0Y-Rxgs-w.text: I went here for my cousin's 12th birthday. It is a nice place with a fun feel to it! There's tv screens and props all around which makes it feel more exclusive than an ordinary restaurant. Service was good. However, when we arrived we did have to sit and wait at the bar for quite a while despite having booked a table. The food was quite nice. However, I'm a vegetarian and there was very limited choice for me. Everyone did enjoy their meal but I'm not sure if it's worth the price! Think you do pay for the novelty value a bit though! Had a lovely cocktail though which was pretty impressive (though still pricey!). Overall, I'd say it's a fun place for a kid's birthday but do bear in mind that you are paying extra for the novelty value of the place. Wouldn't particularly recommend it for a group of adults - there are much better places to eat in London.

ne8WjFqa-Ck16gZ5g3VT9A.text: Beautiful Buffalo wings with Blue Cheese Sauce. Reasonably priced. Nice decor. Drinks quite expensive. Never had a bad meal from there and I have been there quite a few times. Good location too!

sgmz6AJTOzlpG0Td18PQQg.text: First things first - the food here is amazing and the decor is eye catching and fun to look at. But unfortunately its not all good, as the service here has been terrible every time Ive visited. The first time I was told we would have to wait to be seated, which was fine, except 20 minutes later we were still stood there with no explanation as to why we had to wait so long. In the end we left. Hoping it was just a bad day, I returned with my partner a few weeks later. We were seated quickly this time, our drinks order taken and we were given menus. However it then took 20 minutes for our drinks order to arrive, with not a single server walking past us. We complained about this, and were told we'd been sat in an awkward to see place. We ordered food and it took almost an hour to arrive. Despite a complaint, nothing was done about this and we werent offered any compensation for the slow service, being told we can only serve as fast as the food is cooked - fair enough if only we had been informed of this at some point during our wait! Maybe Ive gone twice at bad times, who knows? But what I do know is I wont be going back.

Sa1ykpz4J04GA8DXQmIkEw.text: On a recent trip to London I stopped at Planet Hollywood with my partner for a late lunch/early tea, and out experience was terrible! We assumed that because it was a week day, not a school holiday and not a prime time of day, that we'd have no problem getting a seat - how wrong we were! I can understand that it's a well known restaurant in the countries capital, but we waited at least 25 minutes just to be seated. We shrugged this off and looked forward to our meal - only to wait another 20 minutes before our drinks order was even taken! Service staff kept passing us by, completely oblivious that we hadn't even had our order taken. By the end of the meal we were served by about five different people! I've given this place two stars because the food, although quite expensive, was delicious! The sizzling fajita's were something special! On the whole the restaurant is quite interesting to look at, with all the memorabilia, but the cheesy school-disco dj ruined the whole dining experience! Next time I want to eat at a theme restaurant - I'm going to the Hard Rock cafe!

ZfnSaXAduoQeEU_dV6H2wA.text: This is a great Hollywood experience in itself just to see all of the film memorabilia, and then they also have the fabulous food that goes with the experience. Located right in the heart of Piccadilly Circus it does tend to get busy with the tourists, so you would be advised to book in advance. When we first went in, we spent most of the time just looking around to see what was there and from which films. The menu is also a gastronomic delight with very large portions in typical American dining style. I recommend their Surf and Turf speciality if you want to treat yourself. Prices are reasonable for London in this tourist area.

azM9Tt48icxFqUS16ksJsw.text: We went here for a meal on a Saturday lunchtime for my daughters birthday in June, prior to going to see the Foo Fighters at Wembley. I had prebooked a table online and requested if possible one in the James Bond area as we all like Bond, James Bond. We arrived intime for our reservation and were shown to our table which was indeed in the James Bond room, fab, the tabel also had balloons in place for my daughter which was lovely considering i hadnt asked for anything special apart from the location. The waiter was great, really friendly, service was good and the food we had was infact really nice, my husband and i had steaks and our daughter their unusal lasagne that comes in stood up rolls that look like wraps, she said it was delicious! The food is probably overpriced for that kind of restaurant but we used some Tesco vouchers so only paid for drinks really which was ok, the smoothies are lovely too My husband and i didnt have a desert but our daughter had a sundae and they brought that all decorated with sparklers and played and sang happy birthday to her which was nice. The screens were fun as they had a rolling message display and we had a birthday message put up for our daughter which delighter her. This is a great fun place if you have kids or big kids but its not to be taken as a serious eating place.

gtmIyF-GcaAX5Efa2MAnkw.text: Planet Hollywood in Leicester Square initially seemed like a great place to go for a spot of dinner on my friends 21stbut at the end of the night i realised it was just bog standard food you'd be able to get at your local harvester, that is EXTREMELY overpriced. Between the 3 of us, 1 shared starters, 3 main courses, 3 drinks (non alcoholic) and 3 desserts cost £100 The portions are huge, but the generally taste of the food is nothing to get excited about, i'd prefer quality over quantity anyday. The Menu seemed quite limited in choice, and there is hardly anything to eat for vegetarians. The dessert Menu is also extremely limited. They do offer typical american diner 'junk food' (fries, chips, burgers , ribs, steaks etc) and some pasta dishes, salads, and quite a range of appetisers. The taste is pleasant, but honestly a burger at harvester or KFC would have given me the same satisifaction. If your trying to avoid oily, greasy food definately keep away from it. Its pretty bland stuff but they do serve all their dishes with a range of sauces/dips. The service is extremely friendly, but beware there is a compulsory service charge of 12.5% of the total bill, so we had to tip the waitress a total of £11.00!! :| Not friendly on a student budget.. The surrounds are definately lovely, with a huge TV screen in the front of the restaurant playing some music, and exotic palm trees covered in lights surrounding our tables. The decor had a funky vibe, and the colours are bright, exciting and attractive. There are 2 eating area's and a regular bar area. Despite it being called planet hollywood, there really didnt seem to be that many props from film sets, i dont recall being WOWed at all by anything. They have a few things sparsely scattered around the walls of the buildings, in dimly lit area's and suspended in dirty/worn out looking class cabinets. John travolta's jacket from grease and the terminator outfit was there. I cant even remember what else they had, they do have a few celebrity hand prints, such as will smith, but honestly i didnt find this exciting at all. I just thought they would have had more, perhaps a red carpet, and more glamour. It just seemed a bit tacky and touristy/overpriced.

dWrKdp4jMtv02bBZjjLFhg.text: I recently visited Planet Hollywood with the family and found it to be very overpriced. It is a very fun setting and the kids were very entertained by the big screen (especially as the camera panned round the restaurant, resulting in frantic waving!), however it was very cramped and I got completely wedged into a corner.The food itself wasn't too bad, with the highlight being LA Lasagne but we felt the puddings were a real let-down.We felt that the children's meals did not offer much range and for the price we paid, a bit let down that all the children got to entertain them was a place mat and some crayons.

saC1xx0Y32ig1-saRJ3DCQ.text: Planet Hollywood is something everyone should do when they visit London, not for the food but for the experience.The whole place is decorated with genuine items from films.The food is very over priced and actually not very good. I would stick to the burgers, you can't go wrong with a burger but everything else I've tried on the menu has been awful!

6I5LvBJLCqyDc-NsbKNpkw.text: Spent the evening here, enjoyed a few pints and a really good burger whilst watching football. Good atmos and friendly staff!

meFGc-fyiEiReBB_DbRcvw.text: Not too impressed with this place. Yes, it's fun for kids, and the film theme is well done but it is very expensive for what is actually very basic food. I called in on Sunday evening after seeing a huge sign outside advertising 2 courses and a galss of wine for £10 which sounded too good to be true. It was. We sat down and, luckily, asked about the offer before ordering drinks, upon which the waiter explained that the offer was only valid on monday to friday lunchtimes. Upon seeing the regualar prices, we discreetly made our exit. When we got right up close to the sign, these terms and conditions were displayed, but in tiny writing which was invisible in the dark. I do not think they should display this sign at times (and especially on days) when the offer is not valid. This is very misleading.

4lsDMkz219u6qaTUVETQQw.text: good night at planet Hollywood london the services was brilliant & the food was fab

9P0q-Kdfuc8r-F0QGcwhvw.text: When to Planet hollywood on Saturday night, we were prebooked but they could not find our booking. However after using the internet to find our booking, we were given a table. The manager come to see us as our booking was over due and the table we were given was horrible. He dealt with us perfectly, he moved us to a better table, keep popping over during the night to check everything was ok. The waiter was great, good food. Prices good for london, wouls recommend

P6i5bVH2TRsDOYhF3XSwwQ.text: Here is the place to go if you have abit of cash, and want a good burger and some entertainment. It is very well decorated, and is interesting to see, with paintings, models, various things from films. The big tv plays music videos so is great for the family, as there is something for everyone. The food is scrumptious, serving burgers, chunky chips, and all that brilliance. The portions are big and perfect, the cocktails lovely. I love going here when i'm in the west end. Its perfect for dinner before the theatre or shopping. It does get busy, so you should either book or be prepared to wait a little but it's definitely worth it!

LRiv9JvDgpv38BctK8xDbQ.text: Well where do i start, be prepared this place gets very very busy and as such you may get forgotten and the standard of service may slip. There was a party of 8 of us visited the resturant with 3 young children in the party, We pre booked however still had a 30 minute wait, we were placed in the bond area next to a party of approx 20 15 years olds on a birthday meal. this was terrible there was no control over these people the staff were unwilling to do anything to sort them out or even tell them to quieten it a little bit. The food when it eventually came and it was only after we complained we hadnt even had our order taken after 39 mins of sitting around did they start to do anything was of an average standard nothing impressive about it. The cost was high as you would expect for a popular london resturant. All i can say is i wont be going there again

i41bYOYwF6p7gQm1DRZsYA.text: Great restaurant in the typical Planet Hollywood style. Full of film memorabilia and playing music on large screens. Lively atmosphere and good food, burgers, salads etc and a good range of drinks and cocktails. Recommended.

Uz8yqHsIoPfzpgTToOgHMQ.text: On a weekend away I took the kids for a treat, well at least thats what we thought. Apart from the film props on display, the rest was just terrible. The food was awful and overpriced (and that is the nice version). The restaurant was dirty and the service lacked - everything! It cost us an arm and a leg and we could have had a cheaper and nicer meal in a steak house.

d-GbzlzcZfXAiX_RQalZLA.text: Very busy and quite expensive. Food is good though. Good for pre theatre eating. interesting memorabilia. Good for families.A treat when in London.Shop selling souvenirs and memorabilia.

1PHoJG2Yk438zICBHyhDaQ.text: Planet Hollywood is a fun, funky treat. It serves a generous serving of burgers, salads, pastas, steaks etc. It is expensive when you consider you are buying a burger and chips for over £10 but, you are paying for the fun element. The place is decorated with memorabilia of films etc and there is music playing, with videos on tvs or sports. The staff are very friendly and make the whole dining experience great fun.Its casual, fun, dining out for all the family. Kids will love the fun element, with adults having a feel good factor too.

uvRrzkA1W4abtdT5aV6Ycw.text: We booked here as a treat, it was worth going although a little expensive for what you get. We sat in the James Bond section and had really good time looking around at all of the props from various tv shows and films. Watch out for the video camera that pans round and catches you while you are eating and then is shown on a big screen.

mFIEmVyFdJgp-K__zmancg.text: We visited Planet Hollywood recently prior to paying a visit to the theatre to see Mamma Mia. We were a large group who had prebooked a table. We were greeted when we arrived and were taken straight to our table and then offered drinks. Whilst we reviewed the menus we had a chance to have a look at all the memorabilia that this place has - the Freddy Krueger glove scared me just looking at it! Our starters arrived fairly quickly, plates were cleared quickly and our main course was brought over. Very few of us had room for dessert as the portions are quite generous. Found the costs to be quite reasonable given the restaurants location in the city.

DLq3tUWTGJD5DErRypTMyw.text: Worth every penny. Enjoyed food and drinks. I loved the deco from films. Staff were friendly. My brother and sister were standing on chairs because they insisted because it was their birthday. Reccomended for birthdays and special occasions.

jyOkWgVjZLCabMylF3OCzA.text: Funny thing 'word association.' The great Mr Schwarzenegger has been in the news a lot recently for his little (maybe not so little) jab below the belt - and I couldn't help but reminisce about the many times I have visited a Planet Hollywood - and...somewhat regretted it afterwards - possibly even like the fling that Arnie had 10 years ago. But, he may not have been in a 'Termination' mood back then, in retrospect, all things considered.Like all 'Theme' styled eateries, where you are taken back to another time, and yet another place - with the staff all hoping (rather, praying) you are so engrossed in the kitsch memorabilia hanging from the walls, you forget the time it takes them to refill your glass or even deliver you your meal. Again, Arnie could have frolicked 'Around the World in 80 Days' by the time it took to deliver the grub.Really, are we seriously talking about - absolutely have to have it 'Die Hard' cuisine' here? Alright, OK. I AM being a tad harsh. What were we actually expecting. Lunch at the Savoy? We can, of course, now recite the menu backwards 'cause it reads like most 'American styled glitzy bandwagon - lost all imagination restaurants' which have been cloned out there to the point of screaming annoyance - and, they are still trying to resuscitate the action and keep the theme going like they have done at 'The Aladdin Casino' Las Vegas - ever since Moses lost GPS contact in the Nevada Bull-rushes. But still, if you want longevity, then Planet Hollywood in Vegas is certainly the place, just ask The King of Las Vegas himself, Mr. Wayne Newton. He could very easily pass for one of Planet Hollywood's re-fried shrimps.I guess for nostalgia reasons (we've all got a soft side) we give them a bit of slack - in this case, two marvellous stars in fact. But, once the 'Collateral Damage' hits the table, you realise it just wasn't worth it and then you finally send in 'The Expendables!'

ayLpFGRbqGrT6f0yBPQ8vA.text: Overrated!I never ate at Planet Hollywood even in the states, but we were hungry and did not want to go all the way back to the hotel. The decor on the wall was pretty cool but honestly the food was not memorable(I think I ordered soem sort of Pasta). It was mediocre at best and of course very overpriced LOL. I enjoyed eating local kebabs and halal food more than this spot.

1J6XICngsG4TGplBRaNrTA.text: I remember this place when i was young. It seemed much better back then :s I remember it being accross the road with many more cool movie things. food was medioca

3FpZ3Zxdd7u5j-WWxUJKmg.text: I'm not a fan of these type of restaurants but was pleasantly surprised. Food was pretty good and service / organisation was very good. Expect a fast food experience but a good one !

GuUYWPtYiKVQrGkGht3HfQ.text: When to have to my birthday meal at Planet Hollywood. Had a lovely meal ( big U.S portions, so doggie-bags) staff were great. They have a full calendar of events for everyone to join in.

A9XJnz6viLtMxYTQCTIixQ.text: Planet Hollywood is located right next to the Cineworld at Haymarket, and so it is a somewhat regular place for me to go to if I fancy a drink before a movie (Cineworld is great in many other respects, but it doesn't serve a good selection of alcohols). The place is not too expensive, at least by the standards of the location. But it's quite glitzy. The bar area has a number of television sets which continuously show some sports or musical programmes or wish customers, not all of them kids, on their birthdays. They have quite a good and extensive cocktail menu. They make a really good "Long Island Iced Tea". They serve the drink after mixing the Coke well with the alcohol, just the way I like it. I haven't eaten at Planet Hollywood very often, but there is one dish there that I love. It's their world famous chicken crunch. The four pieces of fried chicken breast are served with a fantastic creole mustard sauce and carrots. The coating of the chicken is slightly sweet, which goes very well with the mustard. I order this quite frequently with my drink. The bartenders here, unlike most in London, do like to talk and they also enjoy their conversations with customers, at least with the interesting ones like me ;) I have many reasons to keep returning.

L4M-tTGWC4n80w5Kv-PWrQ.text: Our group had a great time here. We had a coupon from our hotel lobby for 20% off our order. I had a burger and fries and it was good food. Our waitress was super nice and overall we enjoyed our experience here.

hlLwwJk7-dm1kRcfaSDhKg.text: Hollywood glitz, props from movies, brash style, in-your-face r'n'b videos on screens plastered all over the walls: Planet Hollywood isn't a place I'd usually like. But after a late night visit here, I couldn't help but find myself won over by its charms.Let's get straight to the positives. Unlike virtually all the other restaurants in the area, it's open late, closing at midnight. This makes it a perfect, not to mention highly appropriate place to grab some late munchies after the last showing at the Cineworld cinema next door. The service is friendly and prompt - my friend and I couldn't really have asked for much more on this front.The range of drinks is relatively limited but serviceable: Sol, San Miguel, Amstel, 1664 etc.. My friend and I went for Amstels so can't comment on the milkshakes.Then there's the food. Slightly pricey maybe, but not that extortionate for some of the more common foods such as hamburgers. Plus, in true US style, the servings are very generous: the chicken fajitas I had were very filling and tasty enough. Sure, I wouldn't call it haute cusine, but it's good enough and probably better than you might expect.The negatives? The music is pretty loud, and if you (like me) don't like irritating pop/r'n'b wannabes, can be pretty annoying. The prices are also slightly higher than one might expect, but again, not ridiculously so.Overall: quite a bit better than I expected. I'd definitely consider returning here post-Cineworld for the convenience offered, decent enough food and good service.

GHT_hnJTCxTnHont3UVyng.text: We had planned a great night out for our work team to celebrate and thought Planet Hollywood would be a great place to go because the food and cocktails both looked great. This is probably where the good stuff ended as the moment we arrived we were treated like we were worthless. We had been given gift vouchers to use as a reward  however to the staff this meant we weren't worthy of be treated respectfully as a guest or as a person. When checking in the waitress pointed on a list to another colleague that we were using vouchers at which they rolled their eyes at ach other,.My boss was going to pay separately so she could use a 20%coupon and were told that she would have to sit at a completely different table to use because someone using a discount voucher cannot sit at the same table as someone  using a gift voucher even though these would be on separate bills. I cannot think of anything more ludicrous than this!!Even after speaking to the manager who to be honest didn't look like he could give two hoots we decide to go to Hard Rock Cafe instead. The moment we arrived at Hard Rock Cafe we were greeted in a friendly manner and treated with respect. We had an amazing meal and amazing service- We were able to use our vouchers no problem and then we even left a generous tip (in cash) because we have such a great experience.The fact that Planet Hollywood would rather have customers walk out with an awful experience than make a quite reasonable allowance is beyond me. I have worked  in the service industry for the last 15 years and this would rate up there as one of the worst experiences I have had. It is very disappointing for such a big company to have such a weak store letting down their whole reputation. I will be making sure that noone I know visits the London Restaurant again. Hard Rock is only a few steps away but is beyond miles better in all aspects. There is a reason why Hard Rock have lines out the door every night yet you can walk straight into Planet Hollywood. Don't waste your time! or your money!

KvsM_BOLPaaELDmEoQlfqw.text: I went here for the first time in many years recently and wasn't all that impressed. The food was of a high standard as were the staff but the actual place has let its standards slip I felt. Once upon a time you could choose a room to sit in as long as they weren't booked for parties, but now, even if you book beforehand, you will end up in the main restaurant room, and you can't even look in the other rooms if you ask! Overall, a good standard of food with nice staff, but needs to open the restaurant up more to please paying customers, after all - we pay to see the 'hollywood' props too!

cKscw5WQNa5wmw_V4QZnoA.text: This place is worse than a bad Hollywood B-Movie. In fact Edward D Wood Jr would be turning in his black and white grave at the appalling state of affairs in this so-called restaurant. Planet Hollywood makes the Hard Rock cafe seem like fine dining with it's dreadful offerings that might be fine for a one off at a cool 9 year old girl's birthday party with her troop of budettes, but not for much more. They managed to serve up the worst £5 shake I have ever had in my life. I will try to remember that when I balk at paying £4.50 for a malt or a shake at the Good Life Diner. And just when I thought the Rivington was serving up the most expensive burger in town with their "Luxury" burger of ground Aberdeen Angus Steak, along comes the "Expendables" burger which was nothing more than the cheese burger with a £2 surcharge for the name. In fact the actual cheese burger looked a whole lot better with bacon on it to boot! The old Planet Hollywood up the road might have been cool, but this new place looks like it's a cinema lobby with a few bits of Hollywood memorabilia, from a T-Birds leather jacket to Ursula Andres' underwear, scattered across the walls in no apparent organised fashion, and by no means oozes the same kind of "rock star" status that the hard rock does, or sticky fingers for that matter. Planet Hollywood scores a BIG FAT ZERO in my book and I would never ever recommend it to anyone, unless of course I want to send them to hell.

qAqhh9qQ3KgudKh9noWy9Q.text: If you're going to Planet Hollywood don't expect anything classy. It's loud, full of young people who think really loud music in a restaurant is cool (and why not, I used to) and fast food. The service was very friendly (maybe a bit too much), expect to be asked your life story while deciding which burger to have. I had the surf and turf with a jacket potato. It was all well cooked and better than I thought it would be. There's just something a bit stale about this place, and it didn't surprise me that it wasn't packed out on a Friday night. Why was I there? Well that's another story!

Jp3fGzThBjsQaE9NEJKo7A.text: This place isn't great. In fact, had it not been for an event here, I'd have never got through the door. It's a bit of a tourist trap (the gaggle of student tourists outside when we arrived proved this). BUT, there are some things that make it worthwhile. Ish. There's a lot of memorabilia around the place. And that's cool. Ever wondered where the bikini Ursela Andres wears in the Bond film is (the Spy Who Loved Me?) well it's here. In their private room. With a James Bond Tux. See? That's kinda exciting. And they do a good mimosa too. So extra points for that. Nice enough nibbles, friendly staff, interesting stuff to look at. I wouldn't make a point of coming here again (anywhere on Haymarket actually), but if I did end up here, it wouldn't be the end of the world.

hl2Hf2D6VIW1sHiKn6Fd-Q.text: To my opinion this is overpriced and overrated. The food is nothing special and the staff are quite slow.

KwP2RzFLmpZ3dYasek-3Aw.text: I wasn't happy with the food, the chicken and salad were very dry and it was very overpriced as well. Although I liked the decor of this place and it is open till late.

hgfAe0U5o4FpUyED2FSP7A.text: I liked the Drinks there and the food was ok but some dishes are overprized. It is defenetly something for Families with children!!! Their take care and the staff is polite and very attentive. A good place to be and catch some snacks an a view drinks. I'll be back ;-)

EddAVOcOTIsuCtKHqmYtEw.text: I wanted to like it, really I did. The newly moved Planet Hollywood - it's taken over the Quod site on Haymarket - was going to have less focus on the memorabilia and more emphasis on the food. It's a formula that's worked in other places: the Vegas one is now a well-respected steakhouse for example. Would that work in London? Maybe we'll know one day but for now it's business as usual. And that's not necessarily a good thing. I've got very fond memories of PH from the early days so it was sad to watch standards decline in later years. The food used to be pretty good. No, really, it did. The blackened shrimp in particualr was an excellent dish. That's still on the menu but it's a shadow of its former self. The wings are still first rate - perfect spicing, moist meat, deeply suckable sauce - and I suspect other dishes will pass muster. But the burger has been surpassed by many other places and seriously why offer the chance to have it cooked how I like if it's still going to come well done? Portions are vast, the huge groups of noisy 15 year olds seemed to love it, and the cocktails will certainly keep you buzzing, even if they're a little slow to reach you. A couple though shouldn't have seen the light of day at all. Bleurgh. Still, could all be teething problems - they're sort of soft launching at the mo - and there is still some enjoyment to be had wolfing comfort food next to Indiana Jones' whip. I'm not writing it off just yet.

ppCpse21uWQ9eqZfTU1Kzw.text: They have never, ever changed their menu. And I know, because every time I go there I only order the same thing. Because they only have two vegetarian options - a greasy burger with hardly any toppings, and a plain, mild pasta dish. I go here for the ambience and the creative drinks, and the fact that I love movies more than life itself. I don't mind walking past the garish shop and up the badly lit stairs and feeling like there's zero privacy in the deadly quiet loos. I like this place because it's a tacky Vegas for movies, and I like it.

hsN5tIXOzXjm8l6y1mZ4Yw.text: Booked a table at Planet Hollywood before our theatre trip over the road to see Mamma Mia at the Prince Of Wales Theatre. A good choice on the menu for both children and adults, fairly expensive but as it was for a special summer holiday treat it was OK. I was expecting burgers and chips to be the only food on the menu, so was pleasantly surprised when I managed to order chicken sizzling fajitas! The portion size was uber large but again as it was a treat and not something we do every month it was enjoyable. It came to about £80 for 2 adults and 2 children with meals and drinks (and the 12.5% tip!) The venue was great with film props all around the restaurant including the Hoff's Baywatch shorts, loads of Bond goodies, the Terminator clothes things from Indiana Jones. pretty much loads of film props! They also had a large flat screen where the DJ would zoom around the room and zoom in on people who had mentioned it was their birthday or other special occasions. All in all, a great place to have a lovely, but large meal but it is fairly expensive and busy.

P_WIoWRcr47PZH5HfJaprg.text: I have never eaten at planet hollywood but have hear a lot of great things about it. it has been around as long as i can remember and is in the perfect location. I have been inside to have a look around and it is a typical american diner. I would like to eat there once just to see what all the hype is a bout. Something I have come to realise is that leicester square is not the best area for restaurants and I am far keener on covent garden as the place to spend a night out with the girlfriend for a couple of cocktails and a nice romantic meal!

6Ga0JAaz7Eq4gM4iQbMc4Q.text: First time visiting here with hubby & a very nice place it is. I enjoyed my food which was burger & fries but my hubby did not enjoy his which was chow mien. I tried his chow mien & it was not nice at all, so guys if you are going Planet Hollywood, my advice is DO NOT  order the chow mein.

Xck_nWhYxBvyKZcFaW7FOw.text: WOW, they are still around. Don't see them very often in the US anymore. The burger was pretty good and nice to Arnold at the entrance still holding fort.

imXQYZ7ONEKlc1YNclQMnQ.text: MISS the old PH at Piccadilly... really pitty that this nice Concept was not working, and all Planet Hollywoods closed before i visited all.... In memory of Planet Hollywood in order of my favorites:Hongkong (my favorite), Dubai, London, Taipeh, Paris, Munich, and.... but don´t forget Oberhausen (nobody know why PH was in Oberhausen (germany)...

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom. miss the good old times...

VlaExqTrmWzON_Rn-TaBrw.text: My first time to eat here.  The service is pretty good, on par with other themed restaurants.  I ordered a steak and was pretty impressed with it.  It was really good.  I was expecting a mediocre piece of meat.  It was tasted really good. Fries were also good.  Nice and hot when they arrived.Place was loud when I got there with several birthday groups having a good time with added to the atmosphere.  If your looking for a quiet place to eat, this is not it.  Overall, it was a better than expected experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom

eg2Wr1L8_xUiBkbKz02jNg.text: A lot of film memorabilia to see around hanging on the walls, but the food is of no good at all. Burger and chips feel like eating plastic  - no taste at all. A really touristic place with pricey food for no reason.

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom

kXLsezfIPNXLNUjS-tU7-A.text: Came here for a work event, and we were booked into the Bond room at the back. This room was so cool with loads of bond film memorabilia, including clothing and guns!For me, Planet Hollywood is about these sort of things, and less about the food. At the entrance was one of the Power Ranger costumes from the first film, which was very exciting. We tried their sliders, chips, chicken fingers and nacho chips. The food was all pretty good, nothing outstanding, but was nice. We also had wine and beer. Everyone working there was friendly and attentive (again, we were in the reserved room, not in the dining area)I would come back for a dinner here, or even just drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom. Bond girl

ia0Vb6tNYFB9PdB6GUi02g.text: a little disappointed with the london store. I ordered a vegetarian burger. my only option was a burger with a veg.patty. very boring and not tasty at all. come on you can do better - there are so many options to create a good veg.burger. the fries were good though. my fresh orange juice was okay but not great. the store is very noisy but excellent service. expensive as well, seems like they exchanged the $ with the £. if you want to enjoy the movie/ hollywood flair than this might be the right place - but have in mind that movie trailers were very rare at our visit - music vids were more the standard. staff is superfriendly and the service is speedy-fast but no more planet hollywood for me in the UK (;

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom

F2kdvxua3DKSdCrrqzQ-1w.text: I managed to win tickets to the Star Wars premiere in london Dec 16th, so travelled to london with a friend. Asking him what he wanted to eat, and suggesting nearby places we settled on planet Hollywood. Trying to find it in Leicester Square was confusing as it has moved since I last knew about it lol I even asked a police woman and she didn't know where it was... So I used the iPhone lolWe had nachos to start which was too much for us and didn't have any real flavour. It's a big plate so prob best for 3-4 people not one or two!!I wasn't that keen on my main meal either but as place wasn't that busy at 5pm we could relax before tackling the queue to the premiere! Probably best to eat at other places as it will be much cheaper!!!They took the tastecard discount so at least we saved some money.

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom. Steak
Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom. Nachos - big plate.. It needed jalapenos
Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom

F-X5uQ9JfZdGB5JdMF4A5g.text: They so want to be the family friendly version of Hard Rock Cafe. Service was very friendly and helpful. Fahitas were good but the tortillas were not. No waiting. Nice table.  Star wars and star trek memorabilia was good but seemed a bit distant and unattached. More like a weak museum crying for attention.

fxkmTowY4xeLH5P0cd22zQ.text: The best themed entertainment restaurant you can get in Central London. great tasting meals and drinks. great to see the vast film memorabilia collected over the years hanging from the walls. prices are not cheap but it is London average prices so you shouldn't be surprised.

Zs6DACWlMSjKf9gu_vrD_w.text: The three "R's" ... Rude, Rancid, Rubbish" Soul destroying place with indifferent staff. To be fair the Nacho sharing platter arrived promptly and had been lovingly microwaved to within an inch of its life. The waiting staff had all been expertly trained in not making eye contact or acknowledge diners. This was quite a feat as we were sat next to a serving station where staff congregated. The mains arrived. 3 burger luke warm. 1 portion of chips  between the three of us when we ordered one each and a cheese and tomato pizza tasting of cleaning fluid. Pizza sent back only to be told "we've tasted it in the kitchen. It tastes fine to us". No apology was given. This put a bit of a damper on the day. Would not recommend, go to McDonalds.

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom

MRYQYrJGt3gpqYSZzXNo-Q.text: Another famous place in London for tourist to go to and buy some souvenirs. A neat place to hang-out to drink and eat. Has a lot of famous people's personal items and pictures.

piQXjuEt5LD_6_-AC61TAA.text: The 1st time I heard of a Mai Tai it was here! It was a lot of fun to come here! Great to see the London version of a classic here! The service was awesome! It is so funny that they only put 3 ice cubes per drink! Best to get blended drinks! A very unique experience!

VDZPSLSpvLFFnsm87mvXHw.text: Very accommodating staff and nothing is too much trouble. The atmosphere is really good, but would trying to avoid the lunch time rush. We came at around 2:30 after a look around Leicester Square and were seated immediately. Off for a stroll in St James Park to walk off a great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Planet Hollywood - London, United Kingdom. Start of the weekend at PH.

LOqTuNjj3o7Nkl7kR5mEoQ.text: My partner and I came here for our anniversary, as part of a deal with Ripley's Believe it or Not and were particularly dissappointed.We called ahead three times to ensure, as vegans, we would be able to eat something. We were told, three times, that we would be catered for, and would be given starters instead of deserts.Upon arriving, we were quickly shown to a table, small mercies, but when explaining we're vegan were told there was nothing available, and that we were only allowed deserts as part of the deal, not starters. Embarassed and trying to appease the slightly annoyed waiter, we opted for the veggie burger, containing both milk and egg, and when trying to explain why we weren't particularly impressed were greeted with 'Well it's not like you're allergic or anything is it? It'll be fine'. Needless to say, we ate the chips, nibbled at the burger, and left, without even attempting desert.

TZns8OP7PNI5hPb-Hm4xUg.text: When I was a kid, coming to Planet Hollywood was a rare treat. Now as a grown-up, I'm a little savvier as to how these big-name places operate and know the food rarely rises above average.  So tbh, when my brother suggested coming here, I wanted to scoff, but since it was his treat, I acted all mature-like and demurred. I'm glad I did as I think it was ok after all. The staff were really friendly, the food came fast and portions were generous. And there's so much random stuff to check out - Bruce Willis's outfit from Die Hard, Halle Berry's famous orange bikini etc. It's fun to wander around, even if just once! There's a lot of variety on the menu, in an 'international' style - noodles, burger, pizza, tex-mex. So I thought I'd opt safe with cheesy garlic bread - and interesting with the spinach artichoke dip (which you still don't see much of in the UK). The results were actually converse to what was expected - the bread was dry and chewy, but the dip was spectacular. I know that a lot of food comes frozen here but I'd guess that this dip was fresh made, the spinach was properly green and had a little bite to it, and it wasn't all pulverised as I've seen other dips. I'd actually come back, just to order this starter again :)

-MG7QKxW0Ed_8YKKZLz_MA.text: I went here last night looking for some dessert after eating at another restaurant close by.  First of all, this is a new location but not far from where it used to be.  We went in and asked about dessert and if we could sit in the bar area instead of going to a table and probably waiting a bit longer to be served.  So we ordered a couple knickerbocker glorys at the bar, sat down and they were soon brought to us.  very tasty.Over the years I have loved Planet Hollywood restaurants but to be honest, this didn't feel like one.  True, I didn't go into the main restaurant area where all the memorabilia is located but the bar area didn't sway PH.  I remember that clips from movies used to be played on the television screens but all they had on were music videos that had nothing to do with Hollywood or movies.

aqIvya3J4RIN29J9f6QjUg.text: I went with a friend of mine who desperately wanted to go. The food was ok, but not great. On top of that, the area where we were sitting was quite noisy. One thing that did impress me though was the life size statue of Han Solo. If you're a "Star Wars" fan, you should definitely visit "Planet Hollywood" to check it out. :)

1Y4eZBdGD2mEn_mrt8tBoQ.text: If you really need your fix of American pop culture and food, this is where you need to go.  Typical PH fare - burgers, salads, fried apps.  One of the few places I saw nachos on the menu in London.  Good selection of drinks, friendly service and fairly good amount of movie memorabilia.  Also, there is the PH gift shop.  Typical stuff for sale.  Again, not a bad experience, but usually not somewhere you would want to go in London as a tourist.

EuP2EG1Oy-pykwPaKOqTEg.text: Don't waste your time or money. The food was edible, only because I was starving. Your better off spending your money some place else. Planet Hollywood is a well known name and I expected a good meal. A couple associates and I stopped in for dinner and all three of us were extremely disappointed.
